full_text.full_text:
Binary vs. Multiclass
▪ Binary classifiers
– Assign each data instance to one of two possible labels (e.g., +1 and −1)
– The positive class usually refers to the category we are more interested in 
predicting correctly compared to the negative class
• (ex) email classification → spam(+1), non-spam(−1)
• (ex) cancer diagnosis → malignant(+1), benign(−1)
▪ Multiclass classifiers
– Used when there are more than two possible labels available
– Some classifiers were designed for binary classes only
• (ex) logistic regression
– We will discuss how to transform binary classifiers into multiclass ones
3
